info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 4:24PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Luzerne County through 500 PM EDT... At 424 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sugar Notch, or near Wilkes-Barre, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilkes-Barre, Kingston, Nanticoke, Plains, Plymouth, Edwardsville, Larksville, Forty Fort, Luzerne and Ashley. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 80 near 273. Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 159 and 170A and B. Interstate 476 near 105. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
